intro: Covellia cyrtophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained conditions. Covellia cyrtophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
